results.title: Uncle Smiley goes planting
results.creator_credit: Jim Burroughs, Joe Sutherin and GME Films
results.brief_description: Shows Uncle Smiley and children planting trees in an area ravaged by forest fire, utilising modern reforestation techniques. Also shows other aspects of conservation relating to the usage of the forest. Suitable for middle and upper primary level.

results.title: Uncle Smiley and the junkyard playground
results.creator_credit: Jim Burroughs, Joe Sutherin and GME Films
results.brief_description: Uncle Smiley shows his young friends how a playground can be created from discarded junk. Using hammers, saws, shovels, spanners, wooden boards soon become slides, cable reels become cars and tyres and ropes become swings. Paint, a tree and flowers also help to brighten the junkyard. The children discover that the best play equipment need not be expensive. Suitable for lower and middle primary level.

results.title: Una Filma di
results.brief_description: Designed to promote the Australian Universities Drama Festival. Shows the diverse reactions to an advertising poster ranging from hysteria and swooning to police action. Includes an early appearance by Max Gillies. Written by John Dawson. Music by George Tibbits.

results.title: Two out
results.brief_description: Utilising only one shot and a series of dissolves and jump cuts, this powerful short film examines the relationship between two men who share a single gaol cell. When the subject of the lack of the female object emerges, the tiny space they inhabit erupts into violence and frustrated desire.

results.title: Two architects
results.creator_credit: Ron Parks and British Aluminium Company
results.brief_description: James Gowan and James Stirling discuss the design philosophy and building problems of the award-winning Department of Engineering, Leicester University. The lightly balanced tower of laboratories and offices, engineering workshops and cantilevered lecture halls were built on a difficult site to demanding functional and cost specifications.

results.title: Twelve like you
results.brief_description: Twelve women of varied circumstances describe their career development experiences and suggest how to set goals and take advantage of career opportunities. Some of their achievements include Retail Store Manager, Bank Branch Manager, Telephone Company Technician, Hospital Adminstrator, Equal Opportunity Director, Research Analyst and Deputy District Attorney. Emphasis is given to planning and the determination to succeed against all odds. Introduction and commentary by Jerry Kramer.

results.title: Twelve flags south
results.creator_credit: L.V. Hudson, W.K. Fraser, ABC and International Television Federation
results.brief_description: A documentary on international co-operation in Antarctica among twelve nations - signatories to the Antarctica treaty, which has “frozen” all territorial claims in the continent leaving it a vast laboratory for peaceful exploration and research. The tour includes travelling with the US convoy through pack ice en route to McMurdo station; visiting the Russian base at Mirny and the US base at the South Pole; scientists of many lands working on upper atmosphere research and exploring caves; New Zealand explorers with dog-sledges, Americans in sno-cats, and finally historic films of early explorers Shackleton, Mawson and Byrd.
results.creator_credit_for_label: L.V. Hudson, W.K. Fraser, ABC and International Television Federation

results.title: TVA = Tennessee Valley Authority
results.brief_description: An impersonal survey of the dams built, the irrigation, navigation, and industrial advantages accruing to the people of the Tennessee Valley as a result of this, and the advances made by both agriculture and industry, and social services, since the inception of the Tennessee Valley Authority’s scheme.
